hackathon-description-text: Get tickets & info for DementiaHack Toronto:

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Research Chair, Community Management of Dementia, Ontario Shores Centre for Mental Health
Senior Advisor, Health System Innovation, MaRS
Program Lead, Informatics & Analytics, Ontario Brain Institute

hackathon-eligibility: Developers, designers, business-types, researchers, clinicians, caregivers, and others that are interested in building products to help those with dementia. In person, at the event.
hackathon-requirements: An actually demoable demo. No PowerPoint / slideshow-type presentations; we're looking for functional creations only!
hackathon-rules: Beyond the expectation of consideration and common sense, here are some simple rules:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: NOT A CASH PRIZE: 2 years of free Linode (Platinum Sponsor and Official Hosting Platform!) service to ensure the project lives on! Learn more:
Ubi - The Ubiquitous Computer. It's not even available to the general public yet, and you're going to get to win one. Wicked. Here's their webpage
It's neat! A computer in the palm of your hand. Kind of like a smartphone. Except not a phone. Learn more about the device at

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Consulting session with Pivot Design Group

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How much impact will this have on the person it's developed for? How much will their daily life improve?

Does the project fit into people's lives? If not, is it reasonably easy for people to adapt to the product?

Think "usability".
Can this project be realistically implemented/deployed to the public?

hackathon-description-header: The UK gov is focused on turning prototypes into real, lasting products that actually benefit people. Winners are flown around UK/Canada to demo to major companies and healthcare conferences.
